parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
And, even, also, namely.
Near to, nearly. Neuter of a compound of para and the base of plesion; close by, i.e. almost.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.
